meanings.definition: The beliefs or opinions that are generally held about someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her reputation as a kind person spread throughout the town.
meanings.sent2: His reputation for honesty made him a trusted member of the community.
meanings.sent3: Despite his reputation for being clumsy, he managed to impress everyone with his dance moves.
meanings.sent4: The reputation of the old house for being haunted kept visitors away.
meanings.sent5: The reputation of the restaurant for delicious food attracted many customers.

meanings.definition: The state of being admired or respected by others.
meanings.sent1: She worked hard to build a reputation as a reliable employee.
meanings.sent2: His reputation as a talented musician grew with each performance.
meanings.sent3: The cat's reputation for laziness was shattered when it caught a mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation as a star student shone brightly among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The reputation of the hero for bravery inspired others to be courageous.

meanings.definition: A widespread belief that someone or something has a particular characteristic.
meanings.sent1: The reputation of the town for friendliness attracted many newcomers.
meanings.sent2: The company's reputation for quality products made it a leader in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The reputation of the dog for being a good boy was well-deserved.
meanings.sent4: His reputation for being a troublemaker followed him wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The reputation of the mountain for being difficult to climb challenged many hikers.
